thread.title: PHOTOS: Behind The Scenes Look At The OSU Marching Band In London
thread.title_full: PHOTOS: Behind The Scenes Look At The OSU Marching Band In London

title: PHOTOS: Behind The Scenes Look At The OSU Marching Band In London
text:
Saturday October 24, 2015 6:03 PM UPDATED: Saturday October 24, 2015 7:34 PM LONDON - 
The Ohio State University Marching Band is taking the O-H-I-O to London! 
The Band departed Thursday night and landed early Friday morning. They will play Sunday before the NFL's Bills vs. Jaguars game at Wembley Stadium. 
This year, 10TV has teamed up with the band, as well as the NFL, to bring you pictures and videos from the trip all weekend long. 
TBDBITL spent the morning practicing and even got some sightseeing in! PHOTOS: The Ohio State Marching Band in London 
The team loaded onto buses and headed to downtown London for a parade down Regent Street. 
Earlier this year, interim director Christopher Hoch said the NFL requested the band execute a London-themed show. “(The NFL) left the creative elements up to us. We are planning a very special and exciting performance,” Hoch explained. “It will be a real thrill to have a chance to perform for the people of London.” 
It’s the first time ever the band will travel internationally for a pregame show. 
Buckeye fans may have gotten a little taste last week of what’s to come during TBDBITL’s “British Invasion” themed show during halftime of the Penn State game. “We are very excited to be bringing the Ohio State University to Wembley and can’t wait to see what they have in store for our fans,” said NFLUK Managing Director Alistair Kirkwood. “This will be very different to anything we have done at the International Series games before and we know that the band is planning something spectacular to celebrate and commemorate being in the UK.” Watch all of the 2015 Ohio State Marching Band halftime performances 
The NFL will cover all of the band’s travel costs for the London trip. Kickoff is scheduled for 9:30 a.m. eastern time. 
The game will only be televised in the Buffalo and Jacksonville markets on CBS. However, for the first time ever, Yahoo! will stream the game for free to anyone with an Internet connection. 
Here’s what you can do to watch the game: Connect your device to the Internet. Visit Yahoo.com or install the Yahoo app. Click the link that will appear on Sunday at 9:30 a.m. ©2015 by 10TV.com. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Currently in Columbus
